p: The chemical composition of agarwood has been studied extensively [ 30, 31, 32]. The chemical composition of agarwood from China was the same as that of imported agarwood. Analyzing the alcohol extracts of agarwood from different regions showed that they contained volatile oils, sesquiterpenoids, 2-(2-phenylethyl)chromone, fatty acids, and other components ( Figure 3). Among them, the main volatile oil components in agarwood are sesquiterpenoids and aromatic compounds. 2-(2-Phenylethyl)chromone is a characteristic component that confirms subfamily Agaraceae as an independent subfamily, while its precursor diphenyl pentanone is widely found in plants of the Thymelaeaceae family [ 33].
